channel.title: Modify object: charptr32 attr to inlet
channel.description:
Hello all!
I have been banging my head at trying to simply modify some objects. i'd like to use an external string input instead of an attribute.
I already modified some objects in the past by simply adding an inlet and modifying all instances of "attr_x" into "inlet_x". but for whatever reason I don't understand, the output always gives me "inlet_prefix" instead of whatever string I'm feeding to the inlet… Is there something to declare when using charptr32 inlets and converting such attributes to inlets?
thanks!

item.title: Modify object: charptr32 attr to inlet
item.dc:creator: @lokki
item.description:
@lokki wrote:

yes, that is a bit more complicated then the other inlets.

you will have to copy the string into a variable of type char, look at the string/concat object for a simple example how this works...

Read full topic
item.source: Modify object: charptr32 attr to inlet
